basics.name: Garrick Aden-Buie
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Motivated, life-long learner. Always looking for questions and answers in the data. Passionate about collaboration, sharing knowledge, and communicating insights. Known as a highly organized, empathetic, and resourceful team player.

work.company: Collaborative Data Services, Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Work closely with CDS analysts and Moffitt investigators as a software engineer to design and implement new tools to automate data ingestion, cleaning, normalization and reporting. Provide training and support to CDS analysts in data science best practices, including reporting with R Markdown-based reports, while architecting and implementing new workflows.
highlights: Designed and led trainings in R programming, data analysis, and version control for multiple teams at Moffitt
Developed several R packages to streamline project management, reporting, and access to various databases

work.position: Workshop Instructor: JavaScript for Shiny Users
work.summary: Created an entirely new, two-day, hands-on and project-driven workshop for 90 Shiny users on JavaScript and web development. Developed the js4shiny R package to support the workshop with tools for web development in R and RStudio, including an R Markdown format for literate JavaScript programming and a Shiny app HTML/CSS/JS editor with live preview.

work.company: Gerke Lab, Cancer Epidemiology, Moffitt Cancer Center
work.summary: Conducted advanced bioinformatic and statistical analyses in support of cancer epidemiology research. Applied novel analytic approaches and software pipelines to multiplex immunohistochemistry data.
highlights: Designed and developed a Shiny dashboard interface with companion R package for analysis of the FCDS Florida Cancer Registry data
Created and led an in-depth course on data processing with R for data analysts in Moffitt's Collaborative Data Services Core

work.summary: Led diverse team of Ph.D., masters and undergraduate students in development and evaluation of a large smart-home project for monitoring the daily activities of community-dwelling, independent older adults.
highlights: Managed 3 Ph.D., 5 Masters, and 4 undergraduate REU students while serving as lead software developer for remote sensor data collection, processing, storage, administration, and visualization
Developed several R packages for processing smart-home sensor data
Created large, multi-page Shiny app for sensor inventory management
Designed and implemented notification microservice for near-real-time evaluation and alerting for emergent conditions

work.summary: Developed an R package with embedded Shiny application for Multiple-Choice Test Analysis for educators to interactively explore test results, or a generate reports to guide the design of multiple-choice tests.
Research Assistant for Patel College of Global Sustainability and College of Engineering.

education.studyType:
Masters of Industrial Engineering
Ph.D. Candidate (exited ABD)
B.S. Applied Math, B.A. Spanish, Physics (minor)

volunteer.summary: Served as President of the USF student chapter of INFORMS, the leading international association for Operations Research and Analytics professionals.
highlights: Started a student-led monthly journal club to share and disseminate cutting-edge publications in statistics, machine learning, and operations research.
Organized and led a college-wide code and data bootcamp for undergraduate and graduate students, featuring hands-on learning of data science and programming principles.

volunteer.summary: Served in the Peace Corps in Gualaceo, Ecuador, working in conjunction with local organizations to provide leadership training to children and youth.

awards.title: Runner Up, Shiny App Contest
awards.summary: Selected as one of 10 developers from 136 submissions in recognition of a web app and dashboard built using Shiny. The dashboard monitors social media conversations around a conference or event, and received hundreds of simultaneous visitors per day during RStudio's annual conference in January 2019.

publications.name: shinyDAG: A web application for building, analyzing, and visualizing directed acyclic graphs (DAGs)
publications.summary: Creed J, Aden-Buie G, Gerke TA

publications.name: epiTAD: a web application for visualizing chromosome conformation capture data in the context of genetic epidemiology
publications.summary: Creed J, Aden-Buie G, Monteiro A, Gerke TA

presentations.name: Reproducible Data Workflows with Drake
presentations.event: Bio-Data Club at Moffitt Cancer Center

presentations.name: A Gentle Guide to the Grammar of Graphics with ggplot2
presentations.event: Workshop on Data Analysis Using R (ASA at USF)

projects.name: Scientific Software

projects.name: Open Source Software
projects.summary: I enjoy contributing to open source software projects and have contributed pull requests to many RStudio-supported packages. I also have released the following R packages and projects on GitHub:
